Lebanon Bergejolak, Mahasiswa Indonesia Aman
01 Nov 2019, 15:24 by Retno M


Lebanon Bergejolak, Mahasiswa Indonesia Aman

KBRN, Beirut : Setelah 14 (empat belas) hari, aksi demonstrasi terjadi di hampir seluruh daerah di Lebanon, melibatkan seluruh usia, termasuk dari kelas menengah dan kelas bawah. Dari segi representasi, aksi demonstrasi menyuratkan sebuah problem akut dalam politik yang tidak mampu direformasi dari dalam. Maka satu-satunya cara adalah turun ke jalan agar mendapatkan perhatian serius dari para elite politik.
Kedutaan Besar RI (KBRI) Beirut telah mengedarkan surat Imbauan pada tanggal 18 Oktober 2019 kepada seluruh warga negara Indonesia (WNI) yang ada di Lebanon, termasuk para mahasiswa, agar tetap memperhatikan peringatan dalam surat tersebut antara lain, seluruh WNI diminta tetap tenang dan mencermati keadaan lingkungan tempat tinggal.
WNI di Lebanon diminta untuk menghormati hukum setempat dan ikut menjaga ketertiban umum. WNI diminta agar saling peduli dengan orang terdekat (khususnya sesama WNI) dan selalu waspada terhadap keamanan prbadi dan orang-orang sekitar.
Kepada seluruh WNI diminta untuk menjauhi tempat-tempat yang berpotensi menjadi incaran demonstrasi dan tidak terlibat dalam kegiatan demonstrasi tersebut. Kelima, WNI pun disarankan untuk mengikuti perkembangan lewat media setempat dan himbauan KBRI Beirut di media sosial.
Kemudian, apabila WNI mengalami kejadian yang berpotensi mengancam keselamatan dan mengganggu keamanan, diminta agar segera melaporkan pada keamanan setempat dan menginformasikan kepada KBRI Beirut.
Sementara, pada 31 Oktober 2019, Pelaksana Fungsi Pensosbud, Basyiruddin A. Hidayat telah memastikan keberadaan mahasiswa yang berada di Beirut tetap dalam kondisi yang baik. Dalam pantauannya, Basyiruddin menyampaikan bahwa mahasiswa yang sedang kuliah di Lebanon, mengikuti dan mematuhi imbauan KBRI, sehingga sampai hari ini, Jumat 1 November, mereka tetap berada dalam kondisi yang baik dan aman.

Lebanon Turbulent, Indonesian Students Safe
Nov 01 2019, 15:24 by Retno M


Lebanon Turbulent, Indonesian Students Safe

KBRN, Beirut: After 14 (fourteen) days, demonstrations took place in almost all regions in Lebanon, involving all ages, including those of the middle and lower classes. In terms of representation, the demonstration revealed an acute problem in politics which was unable to be reformed from within. So the only way is to take to the streets to get serious attention from the political elite.
The Indonesian Embassy in Beirut has circulated an Appeals Letter on October 18, 2019 to all Indonesian citizens in Lebanon, including students, to keep in mind the warnings in the letter, among others, all Indonesian citizens are requested to remain calm and pay close attention state of the residential environment.
Indonesian citizens in Lebanon are asked to respect local law and participate in maintaining public order. Indonesian citizens are requested to care for each other with the closest people (especially fellow Indonesian citizens) and always be aware of personal security and the people around.
All Indonesian citizens are asked to stay away from places that have the potential to become a target of demonstrations and not be involved in such demonstration activities. Fifth, Indonesian citizens are also advised to keep abreast of developments through local media and the Indonesian Embassy in Beirut's appeal on social media.
Then, if a citizen experiences an event that has the potential to threaten safety and disturb security, it is requested to immediately report to local security and inform the Indonesian Embassy in Beirut.
Meanwhile, on 31 October 2019, the Executive Director of the Social and Political Affairs Office, Basyiruddin A. Hidayat, confirmed that the students in Beirut remained in good condition. In his observation, Basyiruddin said that students who were studying in Lebanon had followed and complied with the Indonesian Embassy's appeal, so that today, Friday 1 November, they remained in good and safe condition.
